meanings.definition: To guide or lead someone or something out.
meanings.sent1: She was outguiding the lost hikers back to the trail.
meanings.sent2: The park ranger was outguiding the visitors to the exit.
meanings.sent3: The dog was outguiding the cat out of the room in a playful chase.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse beacon was outguiding ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was outguiding the students through the museum exhibit.

meanings.definition: The act of guiding or leading someone or something out.
meanings.sent1: The outguiding of the tourists from the cave was smooth and efficient.
meanings.sent2: The outguiding of the animals from the zoo during the storm was necessary.
meanings.sent3: The outguiding of the balloons from the parade route caused a colorful spectacle.
meanings.sent4: The outguiding of the cars from the parking lot after the event was chaotic.
meanings.sent5: The outguiding of the students from the school bus was organized and timely.
